meanings.sent1: She nulled the contract by tearing it up.
meanings.sent2: The judge nulled the decision due to new evidence.
meanings.sent3: The magician nulled the disappearing act by revealing the hidden compartment.
meanings.sent4: The storm nulled all plans for the outdoor event.
meanings.sent5: The erase button on the computer keyboard nulled the mistake instantly.

meanings.definition: Having no legal force or effect.
meanings.sent1: The nulled agreement was no longer binding.
meanings.sent2: The nulled passport was not accepted at the border.
meanings.sent3: The nulled parking ticket made him feel lucky.
meanings.sent4: The nulled warranty left the customer unprotected.
meanings.sent5: The nulled membership card was useless at the store.

meanings.sent1: He nulled the subscription before the trial period ended.
meanings.sent2: The company nulled the faulty product return.
meanings.sent3: The student nulled the wrong answer with a correction.
meanings.sent4: The chef nulled the burnt dish and started over.
meanings.sent5: The teacher nulled the quiz results due to a mistake in grading.
